channel.title: Fastest way to load spawns?
channel.description:
What would be the fastest method of loading NPC and object spawns?
Side question: Why do I always see max hit, defense and attack levels set by the spawn files? Shouldn't that be preset with the NPC definitions?

item.title: Fastest way to load spawns?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Alright, I was looking at doing that.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest way to load spawns?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:3, topic:463141”][quote author=Cres link=topic=566475.msg4119015#msg4119015 date=1349462690]
The stats of the NPC’s are defined in the spawnconfig.cfg file.
The HP of a monster is defined in the NPC.cfg file.

(This goes for PI)

Try looking in your source files for the part where they construct an npc and try to figure out from which file it gathers it’s data.
Usually the data comes from several .cfg or .txt files.
[/quote]
…
no.

I’m asking what the fastest way is to load these, it’s a Hyperion, meaning, it has nothing. I’m adding the spawn systems myself. I’m just going with XML unless someone tells me other wise.[/quote]

Oh, like that.
Don’t look for speed; you will only have to load objects once which is at the launch of a server. So yes, XML using Java’s DOM parser would be cool ^^

EDIT:
If you really want speed then stay away from XML, loading it from a manually set-up .txt file works good too. (although you really shouldn’t look at the time needed to load, it’s only a matter of a few econds which will only happen once).

Read full topic
